member.name: T:CavemanTcp.CavemanTcpClient
member.summary: CavemanTcp is a simple TCP client and server providing callers with easy integration and full control over network reads and writes. Once instantiated, use Connect(int) to connect to the server.

member.name: P:CavemanTcp.CavemanTcpClient.IsConnected
member.summary: Indicates if the client is connected to the server.

member.name: F:CavemanTcp.CavemanTcpClient.Logger
member.summary: Method to invoke when sending log messages.

member.name: M:CavemanTcp.CavemanTcpClient.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Instantiates the TCP client without SSL. Set the Connected, Disconnected, and DataReceived callbacks. Once set, use Connect() to connect to the server.
member.param: The IP:port of the server.

member.name: M:CavemanTcp.CavemanTcpClient.#ctor(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Instantiates the TCP client without SSL. Set the Connected, Disconnected, and DataReceived callbacks. Once set, use Connect() to connect to the server.
member.param: The server IP address or hostname.
The TCP port on which to connect.

member.name: M:CavemanTcp.CavemanTcpClient.#ctor(System.String,System.Boolean,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Instantiates the TCP client. Set the Connected, Disconnected, and DataReceived callbacks. Once set, use Connect() to connect to the server.
member.param: The IP:port of the server.
Enable or disable SSL.
The filename of the PFX certificate file.
The password to the PFX certificate file.

member.summary: Enable or disable acceptance of invalid SSL certificates.

member.name: F:CavemanTcp.CavemanTcpClientSettings.MutuallyAuthenticate
member.summary: Enable or disable mutual authentication of SSL client and server.

member.name: T:CavemanTcp.CavemanTcpKeepaliveSettings
member.summary: CavemanTcp keepalive settings. Keepalive probes are sent after an idle period defined by TcpKeepAliveTime (seconds). Should a keepalive response not be received within TcpKeepAliveInterval (seconds), a subsequent keepalive probe will be sent. For .NET Framework, should 10 keepalive probes fail, the connection will terminate. For .NET Core, should a number of probes fail as specified in TcpKeepAliveRetryCount, the connection will terminate. TCP keepalives are not supported in .NET Standard.

member.name: F:CavemanTcp.CavemanTcpKeepaliveSettings.EnableTcpKeepAlives
member.summary: Enable or disable TCP-based keepalive probes. TCP keepalives are only supported in .NET Core and .NET Framework projects. .NET Standard does not provide facilities to support TCP keepalives.

member.name: P:CavemanTcp.CavemanTcpKeepaliveSettings.TcpKeepAliveInterval
member.summary: TCP keepalive interval, i.e. the number of seconds a TCP connection will wait for a keepalive response before sending another keepalive probe. Default is 5 seconds. Value must be greater than zero.

member.name: P:CavemanTcp.CavemanTcpKeepaliveSettings.TcpKeepAliveTime
member.summary: TCP keepalive time, i.e. the number of seconds a TCP connection will remain alive/idle before keepalive probes are sent to the remote. Default is 5 seconds. Value must be greater than zero.

member.name: P:CavemanTcp.CavemanTcpKeepaliveSettings.TcpKeepAliveRetryCount
member.summary: TCP keepalive retry count, i.e. the number of times a TCP probe will be sent in effort to verify the connection. After the specified number of probes fail, the connection will be terminated.

member.name: T:CavemanTcp.CavemanTcpServer
member.summary: CavemanTcp is a simple TCP client and server providing callers with easy integration and full control over network reads and writes. Set the ClientConnected and ClientDisconnected callbacks, then, use Start() to begin listening for connections.

member.name: P:CavemanTcp.CavemanTcpServer.IsListening
member.summary: Indicates if the server is listening for connections.

member.name: F:CavemanTcp.CavemanTcpServer.Logger
member.summary: Method to invoke when sending log messages.

member.summary: Instantiates the TCP server without SSL. Set the ClientConnected, ClientDisconnected, and DataReceived callbacks. Once set, use Start() to begin listening for connections.
member.param: The IP:port of the server.

member.name: M:CavemanTcp.CavemanTcpServer.#ctor(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Instantiates the TCP server without SSL. Set the ClientConnected, ClientDisconnected, and DataReceived callbacks. Once set, use Start() to begin listening for connections.
member.param: The listener IP address or hostname.
The TCP port on which to listen.

member.name: P:CavemanTcp.ReadResult.Data
member.summary: Byte data from the stream. Using this property will fully read the data stream and it will no longer be readable.

member.name: F:CavemanTcp.ReadResultStatus.ClientNotFound
member.summary: The requested client was not found (only applicable for server read requests).

member.name: F:CavemanTcp.ReadResultStatus.Timeout
member.summary: The operation timed out (reserved for future use).
